data.title: All 54 Eddie Griffin Movies (in Order)
data.text:
Dive into the world of Eddie Griffin, a talented actor and comedian known for his hilarious performances in a variety of films. In this article, we present a roundup of some of his most memorable movies, offering a glimpse into his versatile acting skills and unforgettable characters. Get ready to laugh, because Eddie Griffin Movies is a must-read for fans of his comedy and those seeking to explore the breadth of his impressive acting career.

As an Amazon‚Ñ¢ Associate, we earn from qualifying purchases.

1. The Five Heartbeats (1991)

The Five Heartbeats‚Äù is a captivating 1991 drama-musical film that explores the rise and fall of an African American vocal group in the 1960s. Directed by Robert Townsend and written by him alongside Keenen Ivory Wayans, this touching story takes us through the journey of five friends who form a group with dreams of success in the music industry.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

2. Dice Rules (1991)

In ‚ÄúDice Rules, ‚Äù the infamous and outrageous stand-up comedian Andrew Dice Clay takes center stage for an unforgettable performance. This feature combines a stand-up concert video of Clay‚Äôs electrifying act in front of a packed Madison Square Gardens audience and a series of uproarious comedy sketches. Known for his raw humor and no-holds-barred approach, Dice Clay delivers a series of side-splitting routines that challenge societal norms and push boundaries.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

3. The Last Boy Scout (1991)

The Last Boy Scout‚Äù (1991) is a high-octane, action-comedy crime thriller starring Bruce Willis and Damon Wayans. The film follows the journey of a seasoned private detective and his unlikely ally, a football player turned vigilante. After a witness to a corruption case is killed, the duo sets out on a desperate quest for justice, pursuing a ruthless politician and a dishonest football team owner.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

4. Brain Donors (1992)

In the hilarious, slapstick comedy ‚ÄúBrain Donors‚Äù (1992), John Turturro, Bob Nelson, and Mel Smith star as a trio of hapless, manic idiots who team up to run a ballet company, fulfilling the will of a generously wealthy man. With their bumbling antics, they seek to outwit a rich widow. Witness the wild spectacle of these unlikely heroes as they stumble through the world of ballet, leaving a trail of laughter and chaos in their wake.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

5. Mo‚Äô Funny: Black Comedy in America (1993)

Mo‚Äô Funny: Black Comedy in America‚Äù is a thought-provoking documentary that explores the rich cultural history of African American humor. As early as the minstrel shows in the early 1900s, to the iconic performances of the 1980s and 1990s, this film unravels the fascinating journey of black comedy through the decades. Yvonne Smith‚Äôs masterful directing and insightful commentary make this documentary a must-watch for fans of dark comedy, African American culture, and history.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

6. The Meteor Man (1993)

The Meteor Man‚Äù is a unique spin on the superhero genre, bringing an African-American hero to the big screen with a dash of humor and action. Directed by Robert Townsend, this 1993 film follows a high school teacher, played by the director himself, who hails from a troubled inner-city neighborhood in Washington D. C. After catching a mysterious meteorite, the unassuming hero finds himself acquiring superpowers that he decides to use for the greater good.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

7. Coneheads (1993)

Coneheads (1993) is a wacky and offbeat comedy from the imagination of Dan Aykroyd and Tom Davis. The film is set in the world of aliens with conical crania who crash-land on Earth, leading to a series of hilarious misadventures. The story revolves around the interspecies romance between the Coneheads, the Parker family, and a Spock-like character. Director Steve Barron, along with writers Dan Aykroyd, Tom Davis, and Bonnie Turner, bring a satirical and satirical take on Sci-Fi, resulting in a unique and entertaining cinematic experience.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

8. The Legend of Dolemite (1994)

Step into the world of ‚ÄúThe Legend of Dolemite, ‚Äù a classic blaxploitation comedy featuring real-life legend Rudy Ray Moore. This 1994 gem takes viewers on a journey through the history of the original ‚ÄúGodfather of Rap‚Äù as he reflects on his illustrious and eccentric career.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

9. Jason‚Äôs Lyric (1994)

In the gritty streets of Texas, Jason and his brother Brian embark on two dramatically different journeys. Jason becomes infatuated with a free-spirited waitress named Alex and dreams of a successful life, while Brian falls into a life of crime.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

10. House Party 3 (1994)

House Party 3, released in 1994, follows the story of Kid (Christopher Reid) as he prepares for his wedding to his new girlfriend Veda. However, things take a turn when his best friend Play (Christopher Martin) decides to throw him the best bachelor party ever. But their plans are upended when Kid‚Äôs three wisecracking nephews come to town, determined to show them what parties are all about.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

11. The Walking Dead (1995)

The Walking Dead, released in 1995, is a gritty war drama set in the heart of Vietnam. Telling the story of a group of United States Marines from 1972, viewers are transported back in time to experience the intensity of war and the harsh realities soldiers face.

12. 3rd Annual Soul Train Lady of Soul Awards (1997)

Experience a night of celebration and recognition as the 3rd Annual Soul Train Lady of Soul Awards takes center stage. This riveting musical event, which aired in 1997, pays homage to the remarkable achievements and contributions of black females in the realms of Rhythm and Blues, Jazz, Hip-Hop, and Gospel music.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

13. Armageddon (1998)

Armageddon is an action-packed, edge-of-your-seat thriller set in the realm of outer space and disaster. Directed by Michael Bay and featuring an all-star cast including Bruce Willis, Billy Bob Thornton, and Ben Affleck, Armageddon tells the story of a team of rough and ready deep-core drillers who are recruited by NASA to save Earth from an imminent disaster.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

14. 4th Annual Soul Train Lady of Soul Awards (1998)

Experience the soulful and electrifying experience of the 4th Annual Soul Train Lady of Soul Awards! This incredible celebration, held in 1998, honors remarkable black females for their contributions to Rhythm and Blues, Jazz, Hip-Hop, and Gospel music. Be prepared to be wowed as this year‚Äôs ceremony is hosted by the iconic LL Cool J, Brandy Norwood, and Brian McKnight at the iconic Santa Monica Civic Auditorium in Santa Monica, California.

15. Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo (1999)

Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo, ‚Äù a 1999 comedy-romance film, tells the tale of an ordinary aquarium cleaner who finds himself taking on the role of a gigolo after a surprising turn of events. Taken under the wing of the original gigolo, played by William Forsythe, Deuce Bigalow learns to navigate the glamorous and entertaining world of male escorts.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

16. The Mod Squad (1999)

The Mod Squad‚Äù, released in 1999, is a thrilling action, crime, and drama movie that follows the journey of three problematic teenagers and their encounter with a dangerous drug ring. These troubled young adults are given a chance at redemption when they are offered a deal to assist an undercover cop in unraveling the sinister web of crime. The stakes are high as the trio, along with the rogue officer, becomes entangled in a deadly setup, which forces them to race against time to expose the truth and clear their names.

17. The 13th Annual Soul Train Music Awards (1999)

Celebrate the vibrant soul of African American music at the 13th Annual Soul Train Music Awards, hosted by the dynamic trio of Tyra Banks, Monica, and Brian McKnight. This illustrious award ceremony, held on March 26, 1999, at the iconic Shrine Auditorium in Los Angeles, California, recognized the remarkable achievements of musicians of color in 1998.

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

18. Mariah #1‚Äôs (1999)

Mariah #1‚Äôs‚Äù is a captivating musical journey featuring pop icon Mariah Carey. Released in 1999, this VHS/DVD compilation showcases the music videos of Carey‚Äôs U. S.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

19. All Jokes Aside (2000)

All Jokes Aside‚Äù is a captivating ‚Äòlaughumentary‚Äô documentary that delves into the lives of African American stand-up comedians in Hollywood. The film, released in 2000, explores the darker aspects of comedy and the challenges faced by these comedians in a predominantly white industry.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

20. Picking Up the Pieces (2000)

In the quirky comedy ‚ÄúPicking Up the Pieces, ‚Äù set in a tight-knit New Mexican village, the locals are stunned when they discover a severed hand that is taken for a divine miracle. Unbeknownst to them, the hand in question actually belongs to a deceased spouse, leading the husband on a hysterical hunt for the hand, resulting in a hilariously dark twist.

21. 31st NAACP Image Awards (2000)

Dream. Achieve.

22. Double Take (2001)

Double Take‚Äù is an action-packed, comedy-infused crime thriller that will keep you on your toes. Released in 2001, this movie stars Orlando Jones and Eddie Griffin as they navigate through a web of conspiracy, money laundering, and identity stolen from a street hustler.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

23. John Q (2002)

John Q‚Äù is a gripping, high-stakes drama directed by Nick Cassavetes and written by James Kearns. The film features a top-notch cast, including Denzel Washington, Robert Duvall, and Gabriela Oltean, who bring intensity and depth to the characters.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

24. Pinocchio (2002)

Pinocchio (2002), directed by the multi-talented Roberto Benigni, is a delightful and imaginative family film that breathes new life into the beloved puppet character created by Carlo Collodi. Set against the backdrop of a whimsical European village, Woody the wooden puppet embarks on a series of exhilarating adventures, with the spirit of curiosity that only a child can truly possess.

25. Undercover Brother (2002)

Discover the thrilling world of espionage and politics in ‚ÄúUndercover Brother‚Äù (2002)! This action-packed comedy follows a group of secret agents, including the suave and stylish Undercover Brother, as they work tirelessly to protect a black candidate‚Äôs presidential campaign from the malicious intervention of ‚ÄúThe Man. ‚Äù

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

26. The 16th Annual Soul Train Music Awards (2002)

Get ready to celebrate the best of soulful sounds with the 16th Annual Soul Train Music Awards! . Hosted by an all-star lineup including Arsenio Hall, Yolanda Adams, Faith Evans, and Shemar Moore, this iconic awards show honors the achievements of musicians of color in 2001. With an engaging runtime of 3 hours, it‚Äôs a night you won‚Äôt want to miss as we pay tribute to the incredible music and talent that defined the year.

27. The New Guy (2002)

In ‚ÄúThe New Guy, ‚Äù high school senior Chris (DJ Qualls) embraces his uncool status in the ninth grade and boldly decides to get expelled, believing that his transformation will lead him to the top at the town‚Äôs other high school. The film showcases a heartwarming and comedic tale of a teenage boy navigating the challenges of adolescence.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

28. DysFunktional Family (2003)

DysFunktional Family, released in 2003, is a comedic documentary following the journey of stand-up comedian, Eddie Griffin, as he returns home for a family reunion. The reunion, hosted in his hometown, is filled with an array of unconventional family members - one of whom is a porn director and the other, an ex-pimp. This quirky ensemble of characters adds a unique spin to the comedy special, making it an unforgettable experience.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

29. Scary Movie 3 (2003)

In ‚ÄúScary Movie 3, ‚Äù Cindy (Anna Faris), who we met previously in her fearless adventures against terrifying creatures, is entrusted with solving the mystery of ominous crop circles and eerie video tapes. As if that wasn‚Äôt enough to keep Cindy on her toes, she‚Äôs also asked to aid the President in stopping an extraterrestrial invasion. As Cindy dives headfirst into investigating these strange occurrences, all while surrounded by hilarious moments and outrageous pop culture references, she puts her unyielding comedic wit and bravery to the ultimate test.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

30. My Baby‚Äôs Daddy (2004)

My Baby‚Äôs Daddy, ‚Äù a 2004 comedy film, follows three young men as they navigate the joys and challenges of unexpected fatherhood. Eddie Griffin, Anthony Anderson, and Michael Imperioli lead the ensemble, tasked with growing up fast as their girlfriends all become pregnant around the same time.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

31. N.T.V. Volume 1 (2005)

N. T. V. Volume 1 is a 2005 American comedy film that showcases the ups and downs of a small-time TV studio in the heart of Los Angeles. The film is directed by Eddie Griffin and co-written by William Duren and Kurt Taylor.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

32. The Wendell Baker Story (2005)

The Wendell Baker Story‚Äù is a charming comedy-drama that follows the life of a good-hearted ex-con named Wendell Baker, played by Luke Wilson. Wendell finds himself in trouble with his girlfriend, but with the help of three charming elderly ladies, he embarks on a mission to win her back. Along the way, they all unite to tackle the corruption in their retirement hotel.

33. Deuce Bigalow: European Gigolo (2005)

Deuce Bigalow: European Gigolo (2005), starring Rob Schneider, takes comedy to new heights as Deuce gets caught up in a web of murderous mayhem with a twist of romance in Amsterdam. The hilarious sequel follows Deuce as he is once again coerced into man-whoring.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

34. Irish Jam (2006)

Irish Jam‚Äù is a delightful, heartwarming comedy that unfolds in a quaint Irish village where the residents unite to save their town from demolition. Faced with the imminent buy-out of their beloved community, the crafty locals come up with a unique plan - they organize a poetry contest with a grand prize - the ownership of their local pub.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

35. The Year Without a Santa Claus (2006)

In the 2006 adaptation of ‚ÄúThe Year Without a Santa Claus, ‚Äù Goodman takes on the role of the jaded Santa, tired of his annual Christmas delivery duties. However, when a young man enters his life and helps him rediscover the true spirit of the holiday season, even the grumpiest Santa learns the importance of Christmas cheer.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

Date Movie‚Äù is a hilarious romp through the world of romantic comedies, directed by Aaron Seltzer and Jason Friedberg. This comedy features an all-star cast, including Alyson Hannigan and Adam Campbell. The film revolves around a man‚Äôs long-awaited date with his favorite girl. However, the encounter takes an unexpected turn when his parents and her father become entangled in hilarious misadventures. The movie is a spoof of those classic romantic comedies, with a mixture of both drama and comedy, and offers countless moments of laughter. With amusing cameos from Michael Jackson and Frodo Baggins, ‚ÄúDate Movie‚Äù is sure to become a cult favorite among fans of the romance-comedy genre. The film‚Äôs catchy tagline and engaging storyline coupled with its impressive box office performance are a testament to its undeniable appeal. With a runtime of just under two hours, ‚ÄúDate Movie‚Äù is an entertaining, unpredictable, and often absurd movie. So, gear up for a wild ride as you explore this outrageous parody of the beloved genre!

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

37. Redline (2007)

Redline (2007) brings an intense blend of action, excitement, and high-octane racing. Following a passionate young automobile enthusiast who is also the lead singer of an up-and-coming West coast band, the movie plunges you into the dangerous world of illegal drag-racing. Organized by adrenaline-seeking exotic car fanatics, this underground world serves as a backdrop for thrilling competition and unexpected twists.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

38. Urban Justice (2007)

Urban Justice, released in 2007, is a thrilling crime drama starring action legend Steven Seagal. This movie follows retired police officer, Jack Tamerlane, played by Seagal, as he embarks on an unrelenting quest for justice after his son, Officer Tim Tamerlane, is brutally murdered in the line of duty.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

39. Norbit (2007)

When mild-mannered and timid Norbit (Eddie Murphy) meets the love of his life, Kate (Thandiwe Newton), things take a turn for the worse. He is trapped in a tumultuous marriage with the monstrous Rasputia (Murphy), a character of incredible proportions. Devising a plan to break free and reunite with Kate, Norbit sets off on an outrageous and hilarious journey of love, passion, and self-discovery.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

40. Eddie Griffin: Freedom of Speech (2008)

Eddie Griffin: Freedom of Speech is a hilarious stand-up comedy special featuring the outrageously funny comedian Eddie Griffin. Filmed before a live audience in Atlanta, GA, Griffin showcases his incredible comedic talent with a combination of personal experiences and edgy humor. Known for his in-your-face style and keen wit, Griffin tackles everything from current events to everyday life in this must-watch comedy event.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

41. Beethoven‚Äôs Big Break (2008)

Beethoven‚Äôs Big Break‚Äù is a delightful family comedy that follows the heart-warming journey between a struggling animal trainer, Eddie, and his lovable dog. When Beethoven, the St. Bernard, lands an outstanding role in a movie through his impressive ‚Äúaudition, ‚Äù Eddie becomes his personal wrangler, catapulting them both to fame.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

42. How Bruce Lee Changed the World (2009)

Delve into the world of groundbreaking martial artist Bruce Lee with the captivating documentary, ‚ÄúHow Bruce Lee Changed the World. ‚Äù This film uncovers the multifaceted impact that Lee had on pop culture, including his influence on China, Jeet Kune Do, the iconic karate chop, combat, and martial arts mastery. Narrated by luminaries like Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, Jackie Chan, and Margaret Cho, this powerful documentary showcases how Bruce Lee‚Äôs legacy continues to shape our world today. Get ready to embark on an inspiring journey through the life and times of the legendary Bruce Lee.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

43. Secrets of Life (2009)

Dive into the world of motivation and inspiration with the 2009 documentary, Secrets of Life. Hosted by the captivating Vivica A. Fox, this film brings together an array of Hollywood celebrities as they share their personal stories of triumph and the secrets that have helped them overcome life‚Äôs challenges.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

44. Why We Laugh: Black Comedians on Black Comedy (2009)

In the captivating documentary ‚ÄúWhy We Laugh: Black Comedians on Black Comedy, ‚Äù directed by Robert Townsend, we delve into the rich and complex world of Black comedy spanning over a century. The film explores the impact and evolution of Black comedians since 1901, providing a unique perspective on humor and the cultural and political contexts that inform it.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

45. 2010 VH1 Hip Hop Honors: The Dirty South (2010)

Experience the magic of 2010 VH1 Hip Hop Honors: The Dirty South, a two-hour celebration of legendary Hip-Hop artists, musicians, and cultural trendsetters from the Golden Age of Hip-Hop. Hosted by the charismatic Craig Robinson, the event honors the Southern region‚Äôs contribution to the world of rap music. Filmed at the iconic Hammerstein Ballroom in New York City, this televised special aired on VH1 and showcases influential artists such as 2 Live Crew and Bun B.

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

46. Eddie Griffin: You Can Tell ‚ÄòEm I Said It! (2011)

Eddie Griffin returns to the stage with his electrifying stand-up special, ‚ÄúEddie Griffin: You Can Tell ‚ÄòEm I Said It! ‚Äù (2011). This one-hour, 22-minute dark comedy promises to leave audiences rolling in the aisles.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

47. Highway (2012)

Get ready for a humorous and unforgettable journey with ‚ÄúHighway‚Äù (2012), also known as ‚ÄúHillbilly Highway‚Äù. Join brothers Earl and Ray Ray as they embark on a wild quest in search of a rumored highway in Kentucky that they believe will lead them to ‚Äúmarijuana nirvana‚Äù.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

48. How Sweet It Is (2013)

How Sweet It Is‚Äù is a comedy-drama musical film released in 2013. The story revolves around an alcoholic theatre owner struggling to stage a successful musical while dealing with his mob debt. The wise guys who back him want their friends to be cast in the production, leading to various challenges.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

49. Going to America (2014)

Going to America is a hilarious 2014 comedy-drama film that will leave you in fits of laughter. The movie follows the story of Fumnanya, an African prince played by Eddie Griffin, who dreams of finding a princess to kiss. Along with his trusty sidekick, Andy, Fumnanya embarks on an unorthodox journey to Los Angeles in a quest for true love.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

50. American Hero (2015)

American Hero‚Äù boldly redefines the superhero genre with its electrifying mix of comedy, action, and drama. The film follows the story of Melvin, a self-proclaimed reluctant hero, who leads a life immersed in crime, women, and drugs. But, there‚Äôs one desire he refuses to give up on - reuniting with his estranged son. In a twist of fate, he realizes that the only way to truly bond with his son is to make a drastic turn and become a crime-fighting hero.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

51. All About the Money (2017)

All About the Money‚Äù is a high-energy, action-packed comedy adventure, set in the hot and tumultuous landscape of Colombia. Released in 2017, this intriguing feature film comes from up-and-coming directors Blake Freeman and Danny West, and is penned by the talented Lester Korman.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

52. Def Comedy Jam 25 (2017)

Celebrate 25 years of groundbreaking comedy as Def Comedy Jam 25 takes you on a hilarious journey through the iconic HBO series that dominated the 90s. In this star-studded TV special, witness surprise guests and heartfelt tributes as they pay homage to the unforgettable moments that have left audiences laughing for a quarter of a century. Bringing together an all-star cast including Dave Chappelle, Tiffany Haddish, and Steve Harvey, Def Comedy Jam 25 is a must-see for any comedy lover.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

53. A Star Is Born (2018)

A Star Is Born‚Äù is a gripping drama that explores the intimate relationship between a musician and a young singer, as they navigate the world of fame and personal struggles. Directed by Bradley Cooper, this heart-rending film showcases the power of music and the complexities of human connections.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art

54. The Comeback Trail (2020)

The Comeback Trail‚Äù is a darkly humorous crime-comedy film released in 2020, directed by George Gallo and starring Robert De Niro, Tommy Lee Jones, and Morgan Freeman. The story follows an eccentric film producer who owes a hefty debt to a dangerous mobster. In a desperate effort to pay it off, the producer hatches a seemingly foolproof plan: he‚Äôll pay off the debt by orchestrating the accidental demise of his movie star, who‚Äôs an aging Western icon known for his iconic cowboy hat and lever action rifles.

üì∫ Watch now free with Prime

üñºÔ∏è Check out these cool movie posters & art
